title: Facebook's Zuckerberg Backs Privacy Legislation
summary: Mr. Zuckerberg's remarks come hours after White House called for social-media summit to have 'robust conversation' about responsibility of online platforms. Mark Zuckerberg, chief executive and co-founder of Facebook Inc., endorsed federal privacy legislation and greater regulation of political advertising, even as he cast governments as too slow to address many of the internet's thorniest problems.

title: Broadway Musicians, Producers Reach Contract Deal
summary: Agreement will provide the largest wage increase in two decades, union says. Broadway musicians have a new three-year contract that includes what union officials say is the largest wage increase in two decades.

title: Analysis: Walmart's Spend-and-Tell Strategy Paid Off in Bribery Settlement
summary: The retailer spent over $900 million on investigations and compliance enhancements during a probe into alleged Foreign Corrupt Practices Act violations. Quarter after quarter, the figure grew. By the time Walmart Inc. reached a long-awaited settlement with U.S. authorities last week, the company had amassed more than $900 million in costs from compliance enhancements and internal investigations into foreign bribery law violations in Mexico, Brazil, China and India.

title: Huawei Loses Trade-Secrets Dispute With Startup
summary: CNEX Labs claimed Huawei engaged in multiyear conspiracy to steal storage technology information. A Texas jury has found that Chinese telecom giant Huawei Technologies Co. misappropriated the trade secrets of a Silicon Valley chip startup.

title: Europeans Plan to Inject Capital Into Iranian Trade Effort
summary: Credit line would kick-start trade between Iran and Europe. BRUSSELS-European governments will double down this week on their efforts to keep alive economic ties with Iran, officials said, providing a credit line to help a special mechanism establish a route for trade between Iran and the West.

title: Chief of New York's Top Real-Estate Group to Step Down
summary: John Banks to retire from Real Estate Board of New York, following industry's historic defeat at hands of state lawmakers. The head of New York City's largest real-estate trade and lobbying organization is stepping down just weeks after the State Legislature dealt the industry one of its worst defeats in decades.

title: An Open Letter to Patriotic Billionaires
summary: Raise our taxes, they plead. So why not start writing checks today?. Nineteen uberwealthy Americans posted an open letter Monday calling on "all candidates for President" to support a "moderate" wealth tax. Signatories include the investor George Soros, Berkshire Hathaway scion Molly Munger, Mickey Mouse heiress Abigail Disney, Facebook co-founder Chris Hughes, and a couple of Hyatt Hotel progeny from the Pritzker family.

title: Sobriety About the Commerce Clause
summary: The High Court strikes down a protectionist state liquor law.. One goal of the U.S. Constitution was to form a union that allowed interstate commerce unencumbered by state protectionism. The Supreme Court reinforced that principle on Wednesday by striking down a two-year residency requirement to get a liquor license in Tennessee.

title: The Case of Excessive Deference
summary: Chief Justice Roberts joins the liberals in deferring to regulators.. The Supreme Court's new majority has made notable strides strengthening the separation of powers. But on Wednesday Chief Justice John Roberts blinked in a case involving the administrative state and joined the four liberal Justices to preserve the Court's misconceived Auer precedent.

title: MSNBC Seeks Major Ad Markup in First Two Democratic Debates
summary: NBCUniversal didn't offer debate advertisers audience guarantees nor a choice of which night they wanted to air. Advertisers were asked to pay up to $100,000 for 30-second spots on MSNBC during the Democratic presidential primary debates this week, according to people familiar with the matter, signaling that the network anticipates high viewer interest for its kickoff to the 2020 campaign season.

title: Oberlin's $44 Million Mistake
summary: An Ohio jury sends a message about politics to colleges: Enough is enough.. After a Lorain County, Ohio, jury awarded Gibson's Bakery $44 million this month in its defamation suit against Oberlin College, the store's owner, David Gibson, said: "We appreciate that the jury understood what we had gone through, and I think they were saying to the entire country that we can't allow this to happen to hard-working small-business people whose lives are defined by their business, their family, and their community."

title: Trump Is the Worst Kind of Socialist
summary: His policies coddle fellow oligarchs while leaving ordinary people at the mercy of the free market.. "America will never be a socialist country," President Trump said as he launched his bid for re-election last week.

title: The Democrats' Tech Cash Machine
summary: The GOP is finally imitating ActBlue, which has dominated small-donor giving since 2004.. At the dawn of the modern political era, about 50 years ago, Republicans dominated small-dollar campaign giving using the then-new technology of direct mail. This leveled the playing field with Democrats, who depended on large contributions from unions, trial lawyers and wealthy liberals.

title: Hold Russia Accountable for MH17
summary: European investigators charge four men with murder, but evidence of Russian guilt is powerful.. Four men have been charged with murder in connection with the 2014 destruction of Malaysia Airlines Flight 17, which killed 298 passengers. But the Dutch-led Joint Investigation Team can't produce justice in the case unless the U.S. is ready to hold Russian President Vladimir Putin accountable. Russian authorities are refusing to cooperate with the investigation, and Mr. Putin told journalists last week that there's "absolutely no proof" Moscow participated. In fact, evidence that the Putin regime deliberately targeted a passenger jet is overwhelming.

title: Defend Our Drones
summary: Unmanned aircraft are susceptible to embarrassing attacks in ways that we would never allow for manned planes.. The loss of a large Global Hawk reconnaissance drone to an Iranian missile last week should be a wake-up call. America's unmanned aerial vehicles are very useful, but they're also vulnerable. The Iranians appear to have used a local version of an SA-5, a 1970s Soviet long-range missile. That was the same weapon Moammar Gadhafi's Libya used unsuccessfully against U.S. Navy planes in 1986 and Syria has used with minimal success (at most one hit out of dozens fired) against Israel.

title: Stand Up for Beijing's Hostages
summary: U.S. national security depends on a show of solidarity with Canada.. When Donald Trump meets Chinese President Xi Jinping on the sidelines of Japan's G-20 summit that begins Friday, his challenge is to reboot U.S.-China trade talks while safeguarding the American interests that make a deal worthwhile. Those interests should include securing the freedom of two Canadians unjustly detained in China.

title: Who Pays for Student-Debt Forgiveness?
summary: Taxpayers who didn't go to college, didn't take on debt, or paid it off already.. Democrats have begun a bidding war over student-debt forgiveness. Joe Biden proposes to expand it for public-school teachers. Elizabeth Warren wants to forgive 75% of all student debt. Bernie Sanders has raised the stakes to 100%.

title: 'The Edge of Every Day' Review: The Shapeless Thief
summary: A beautiful and tragic memoir about a "multiplex" family in which schizophrenia becomes more severe with each generation.. Marin Sardy opens "The Edge of Every Day: Sketches of Schizophrenia" with an essay-length series of fragments from her childhood-"my dog, stuck in a tree"; "the map of the world that my brother hung upside down on his bedroom wall"; "the ash that fell from the sky and coated Anchorage in gray dust a few days after Mount Augustine erupted." The essay is beautiful in its way, but some of the fragments portend ill. She remembers her mother sitting on the sofa late in the evening, "rhythmically grinding her teeth." And once, when the author was 12, her mother asked her: "Do you ever hear people calling out to you, but you can't tell who it is?"

title: Can This Rally Last? Options Traders Say Yes
summary: Optimism rises after Fed raises expectations of rate cuts this year and Trump tweets about talks with Chinese leader. As U.S. stocks trade near highs, some options traders are poised for greater gains.

summary: Their median compensation of $22.6 million last year ranked as the highest for any S&P 500 sector. Media titans came under heavy scrutiny in 2018 for their business practices and deal making, but they were well-compensated for their trouble.

title: Reddit Puts Limits on Pro-Trump Discussion Group
summary: Popular chat forum said members threatened violence against law enforcement and public officials, a violation of its user policies. Reddit Inc. quarantined a pro-Trump user group on its platform Wednesday after it said members threatened violence against both law-enforcement officers and public officials, marking the latest example of the challenges that social-media companies face in managing politically charged discourse.

title: Wayfair Workers Stage Walkout Over Sales to Border Camps
summary: Employees protest online retailer's sale of $200,000 of furniture to operator of detention facility for migrant children. BOSTON-Employees of Wayfair Inc. walked out of the company's Boston headquarters on Wednesday in protest of the online retailer's sale of $200,000 worth of bedroom furniture to a southern border facility for migrant children seeking asylum in the U.S.

title: House Panel Questioned Businessman on Trump Moscow Dealings
summary: Giorgi Rtskhiladze met with staff from both parties about his discussions with Trump Organization, Michael Cohen. title: Yum Brands Turns to Former PepsiCo Executive for CFO
summary: Fast-food company fills finance chief position after a nearly five-month long search. Yum Brands Inc. on Thursday tapped a former PepsiCo Inc. executive to lead its finance team, closing out a nearly five-month long search for a chief financial officer.

title: CIOs See End of 'AI Gone Wild' in Congressional Hearings
summary: Regulation is expected eventually, but experts say it should be crafted in a way that avoids hampering innovation. title: Venezuelan Oil Officials Sue to Reclaim Citgo
summary: Directors loyal to President Nicolás Maduro file a lawsuit against opposition appointees for control over refiner. summary: 10-year U.S. Treasury yields rise above 2%. Major U.S. stock indexes were mixed as investors waited for developments on a trade deal with China.

summary: Public defender had a lead of about 1,000 votes over Melinda Katz, the Queens borough president. On Tuesday night, with the Democratic primary still too close to call, she declared herself-and her far-left approach to criminal justice-the winner.

title: Oil Jumps on Supply Concerns, as Stockpiles Fall by Most Since 2016
summary: The gains pushed a two-week rally above 16% following a monthly low on June 12. Oil prices climbed Wednesday after U.S. oil inventories had their biggest one-week drop since 2016 and investors shifted their focus to supply.

title: Natural Breeding Under the Spreading Chestnut Tree
summary: The American chestnut requires no genetic rescue, and it is not rare.. Throughout our eastern mountain forests, chestnut stems still sprout from the roots of the original chestnuts killed by blight in the first half of the last century. And some of those chestnuts weren't killed by the blight.

The bigger issue, he says, is that they weren't any good.

title: Facebook's Libra Could Give Dollar, Banks Some Welcome Competition
summary: By creating a de facto central bank, Libra could succeed where other cryptocurrencies fall short. The payment system remains one of the last true monopolies of a modern economy. If you want to use the local currency, you pretty much have to go through your central bank and banking system with all its rules, restrictions and fees.

title: U.S., North Korea in Informal Talks for Third Summit, South Korea Says
summary: The South Korean president didn't provide a timeline for another meeting between Trump and Kim Jong Un. SEOUL-The U.S. and North Korea have been engaged in informal talks about a third nuclear summit between the two countries' leaders, South Korean President Moon Jae-in said, signaling an interest by both sides in breaking a monthslong lull in negotiations.

title: First IPO on China's Nasdaq-Style Tech Board Sparks a Small Frenzy
summary: The stock offering for HYC Technology was more than 300 times oversubscribed. SHANGHAI-China's latest experiment with a Nasdaq-like listing venue for homegrown technology companies got a boost this week, after the first initial public offering of an electrical-equipment maker drew hordes of investors.

title: New York's Affordable-Housing Agency Overhauls Middle-Income Program
summary: Restructuring comes after investigators found bribery, fraud and abuse of power in some complexes.

title: Japan's Banks Squeezed by Zero-Yield Experiment
summary: Market demand for the 10-year bonds has pushed yields well below the zero target; 'like squeezing water from a dry rag'. TOKYO-The global trend toward lower interest rates is threatening one of the world's most unusual experiments in central banking.

title: A Unified Iranian Leadership Stands Up to U.S.
summary: Resume Subscription. BEIRUT-The Trump administration is facing an Iranian leadership publicly united behind a more confrontational approach as tensions come to a head between Washington and Tehran.

title: N.Y. Politicians Write More Laws Than Anyone Else, and Make Mistakes
summary: Lawmakers passed nearly 1,000 bills in the last six months. ALBANY, N.Y.-New York state lawmakers considered 1,825 bills over 13 days in June, more than some states introduce in an entire year, often voting over copious cups of coffee during late-night sessions that stretched past midnight.

title: The Soccer Team Built to Beat the U.S.
summary: With increased funding from the sport's top clubs and a swaggering style, France has emerged as a superpower-designed to take down the Americans. PARIS-The highest compliment anyone ever paid the French national team, as far as its captain is concerned, came in the heat of the moment from Abby Wambach.

title: Key Chinese Lending Rate Hits Lowest Since 2009
summary: Rate at which Chinese banks lend to each other overnight falls as regulators try to reassure markets spooked by state takeover of a bank. SHANGHAI-Short-term borrowing costs between Chinese banks dropped to their lowest levels in a decade, as regulators sought to reassure markets that were spooked by the government takeover of a troubled bank last month.

title: Why This Time Is Different for CBS and Viacom
summary: Companies have faced obstacles to merging before, but conditions have changed. Merger talks between CBS and Viacom have started to resemble a scene from "Groundhog Day." CBS is planning an offer for its sister company, The Wall Street Journal reported last week, which would mark the third attempt to combine the companies in four years. Investors could be forgiven for thinking they are reliving the same sequence of events ad nauseam.

title: Kraft Heinz CEO Looks to Ketchup for Sales Spurt
summary: Miguel Patricio says well-known products need new boost. Kraft Heinz Co. 's new chief executive is taking over at the lowest point in the food conglomerate's history.

title: NSA Improperly Collected U.S. Phone Records a Second Time
summary: Documents show the agency gathered metadata about calls and text messages last October in error. The National Security Agency collected records about U.S. calls and text messages that it wasn't authorized to obtain last year, in a second such incident, renewing privacy concerns surrounding the agency's maligned phone-surveillance program, according to government documents and people familiar with the matter.

title: The Best Frequent-Flier Awards Programs of 2019
summary: Airlines have finally figured out that they need to make free seats more available-here's who gets the job done, and who's lagging behind. Those stingy airlines have had a change of heart with their frequent-flier programs. They've made more award seats available, and are bringing down the prices in miles or points, too.

title: Hopes for Resolving U.S.-China Trade Fight Hinge on Trump and Xi
summary: An escalating trade fight seems likely if the two leaders can't call a truce at the G-20 meeting in Japan. WASHINGTON-President Trump and Chinese President Xi Jinping will seek to revive troubled U.S.-China trade talks this week, in a test of whether their professed personal chemistry can surmount seemingly intractable differences at the bargaining table.

title: Overdose Deaths Likely to Fall for First Time Since 1990
summary: Health officials and scientists warn U.S. is far from defeating drug epidemic. For the first time in decades, drug-overdose deaths in the U.S. are on the precipice of declining.

title: Facebook Says Libra Can Change the World. It Needs to Convince Users.
summary: The key to getting consumers and merchants to use the digital currency will be incentives. Facebook Inc. has big plans to remake the financial system with its cryptocurrency-based payments network. First, it has to get people to use it.

title: Treasury Investors, Get Ready for the Japanese Cavalry
summary: When the cost of hedging against currency risk falls, Japan's big investors head back to the U.S. government bond market. Investors are often preoccupied with vivid forecasts of what China might do with its hoard of U.S. Treasury bonds. For the real action, they need to look a little further east.

title: Robert Mueller to Testify in Open Session
summary: Special counsel will appear on July 17. WASHINGTON-Robert Mueller will testify in open session next month before a pair of House committees, in a victory for the Democratic leaders who had long sought his testimony in public.

title: Democratic Debates Put Candidates in Spotlight: Here's What to Watch
summary: Joe Biden takes stage as front-runner and Elizabeth Warren comes in with momentum as 20 presidential candidates debate over two nights. The crowded Democratic presidential field converges on Miami this week for two televised debates, giving millions of Americans their first chance to compare the candidates looking to unseat President Trump.

title: Pompeo Sees Afghan Peace Deal Possible by September
summary: U.S. and Taliban negotiators are set to start another round of talks later this week in Qatar. NEW DELHI-Secretary of State Mike Pompeo said that "the hour has come for peace" in Afghanistan and that he hopes there will be a peace deal with the Taliban by September.

title: Queens Democratic Primary for District Attorney Too Close to Call
summary: Public defender Tiffany Cabán, who won the support of the far left, holds narrow lead over Borough President Melinda Katz. An insurgent challenger held a narrow lead over a longtime local politician in the Queens Democratic primary, a vote likely to determine the borough's first new top prosecutor in nearly three decades.

title: Pepper...and Salt
summary: Resume Subscription. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: One State's Effort to Publicize Hospital Prices Brings Mixed Results
summary: New Hampshire's experience suggests what the Trump administration move may-and may not-accomplish. As the Trump administration moves to make confidential hospital prices public, New Hampshire's dozen years of experience with price transparency suggests what it may-and may not-accomplish.

title: American Tech Companies Find Ways Around Huawei Ban
summary: Huawei was until recently a prolific buyer of U.S. technology. Large U.S. tech companies in the direct sights of the Trump administration's ban on exports to Huawei Technologies Co. are finding ways to resume some shipments to the blacklisted Chinese tech giant without running afoul of American regulations.

title: John Sanders Resigns as Head of Customs and Border Protection
summary: Departure comes as administration deals with crisis of families and children in U.S. custody. A top U.S. border-enforcement official resigned amid growing clamor about the treatment of migrant children in U.S. custody, while the House approved billions of dollars in funding to address the surge of Central American families seeking asylum at the southwest border.

title: House Passes $4.5 Billion Bill for Humanitarian Assistance at Border
summary: White House has threatened to veto it; Senate is expected to vote on its own bill this week. WASHINGTON-The House passed a $4.5 billion bill funding food, water and shelter for people entering the U.S. at the southern border after Democrats pushed through last-minute changes to win support from progressive and Hispanic lawmakers.

title: Netflix to Lose No. 1 Show 'The Office' to Comcast in 2021
summary: Other popular reruns could also leave the platform, as NBCUniversal and other media companies look to bring back hit shows to their streaming services. Netflix Inc. will lose its No. 1 show, "The Office," in 2021 when reruns of the hit sitcom move to a new streaming service being launched by Comcast Corp.'s NBCUniversal, the latest sign of competition over top programming among Hollywood's titans.

title: Canada Suspends Meat Exports to China
summary: Ottawa halts shipments after its probe finds forged certificates tied to pork sales. OTTAWA-Canada late Tuesday halted all China-bound meat exports after a probe sparked by Beijing's concerns revealed forged certificates related to certain shipments of Canadian pork.

title: New York City Rent Board Again Approves Modest Boost
summary: The vote calls for a 1.5% increase for one-year leases and a 2.5% rise on two-year leases-the same as in 2018.

title: AbbVie Strikes Deal to Acquire Allergan for About $63 Billion
summary: Drugmakers agree to one of the biggest mergers in the health sector this year. AbbVie Inc. agreed to buy Allergan PLC for about $63 billion in a bet by the two drugmakers that a combination will deliver new sources of growth that they have struggled to find on their own.

title: Pilot Killed in Manhattan Copter Crash Saw '20-Minute Window' in Bad Weather
summary: Licensed commercial pilot wasn't certified in instruments needed in bad weather. The pilot of a helicopter that crashed atop a Midtown Manhattan skyscraper in bad weather thought he saw a window of opportunity to fly, according to federal investigators.

title: FAA Reassigns Senior Managers in Office Overseeing Southwest Airlines
summary: Move comes amid inquiries into allegations of lax safety enforcement. The Federal Aviation Administration has removed three senior managers in the office overseeing Southwest Airlines Co. , amid allegations of lax safety enforcement raised by agency whistleblowers and various resulting government inquiries, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: TechnipFMC Agrees to Pay Around $300 Million to Resolve Foreign Bribery Probes in U.S., Brazil
summary: A former consultant to the company also pleaded guilty to conspiring to violate the Foreign Corrupt Practices Act. TechnipFMC PLC and a U.S. subsidiary agreed to pay about $300 million to settle joint foreign bribery probes in the U.S. and Brazil, the oil-and-gas services company said Tuesday.
